bibl.title: Letter fragment from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter?], [19--]

div1.p: [Carter] writes about his travel plans and work.

div1.head: Letter fragment from [Henry Rose Carter] to [Laura Eugenia Hook Carter?], [19--]
div1.opener:
Caters especially to Commercial Travelers.
FIREPROOF
150 ROOMS - 75 WITH BATH.
EDGAR B. MOORE, PROPRIETOR.
The Selmyn
European or
American, Plan.
·Modern and Luxurious·
Charlotte, N.C.
Dear Mrs Ma:
div1.p:
I sent a telegram to the Bu-
reau last night. advising that I came
to Washington for a conference - so
that I may tell them what change
of plan is necessary on account of
going off with Gorgas. If they so
advise well. If not I will come
leave for Home this work any how
how on leave granted by my self,
& stay there until I start off -a-
bout June 15. maybe 10 or 12,
I am going to Parr's Shoals
2
this afternoon. but will only re-
main there a few days. I have
settled matters with the South-
ern Power Co here & neds need
not go to Great Falls, settled
very satisfactorily too- very satis-
factorily.

My address for the next few
days will be, “Columbia S. C.
Care State Board of Health”,
I will be at Parr's shoals.

Gorgas letter - June 24. said he
had seen Laura & she was looking
very well. I was afraid she had
been frozen out. The first week
3
was so cold.

I will enclose his, g. letter,
she. L. will be with you I judge
tomorrow or next day & I presume
you rec'd her -(L's) letter the
now or will receive it the last mail today today
or will receive it the last mail
today.

I am wonderfully improved. since
I left, Not up to normal, but very
much better than when I left
I do not carry my suit-case
even yet when I can help it & do notnot
hurry. I pack it very light also
Also I will see the last of the Iris
